member.summary: The edit box and the dropdown list will not display item images.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ComboBoxExStyle.CBES_EX_PATHWORDBREAKPROC
member.summary: Windows NT only. The edit box will use the slash (/), backslash (\), and period (.) characters as word delimiters. This makes keyboard shortcuts for word-by-word cursor movement effective in path names and URLs.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ComboBoxExStyle.CBES_EX_NOSIZELIMIT
member.summary: Allows the ComboBoxEx control to be vertically sized smaller than its contained combo box control. If the ComboBoxEx is sized smaller than the combo box, the combo box will be clipped.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ComboBoxExStyle.CBES_EX_CASESENSITIVE
member.summary: BSTR searches in the list will be case sensitive. This includes searches as a result of text being typed in the edit box and the CB_FINDSTRINGEXACT message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ComboBoxExStyle.CBES_EX_TEXTENDELLIPSIS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Causes items in the drop-down list and the edit box (when the edit box is read only) to be truncated with an ellipsis ("...") rather than just clipped by the edge of the control. This is useful when the control needs to be set to a fixed width, yet the entries in the list may be long.

member.summary: The COMBOBOXEXITEM structure that holds item information specific to the current notification. Upon receiving a notification code, the COMBOBOXEXITEM structure holds information required for the owner to respond. The members of this structure are often used as fields for the owner to return values in response to the notification.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM
member.summary: Contains information about an item in a ComboBoxEx control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.mask
member.summary: A set of bit flags that specify attributes of this structure or of an operation that is using this structure. The flags specify members that are valid or must be filled in.

member.summary: The zero-based index of the item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.pszText
member.summary: A pointer to a character buffer that contains or receives the item's text. If text information is being retrieved, this member must be set to the address of a character buffer that will receive the text. The size of this buffer must also be indicated in cchTextMax. If this member is set to LPSTR_TEXTCALLBACK, the control will request the information by using the CBEN_GETDISPINFO notification codes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.cchTextMax
member.summary: The length of pszText, in TCHARs. If text information is being set, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.iImage
member.summary: The zero-based index of an image within the image list. The specified image will be displayed for the item when it is not selected. If this member is set to I_IMAGECALLBACK, the control will request the information by using CBEN_GETDISPINFO notification codes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.iSelectedImage
member.summary: The zero-based index of an image within the image list. The specified image will be displayed for the item when it is selected. If this member is set to I_IMAGECALLBACK, the control will request the information by using CBEN_GETDISPINFO notification codes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.iOverlay
member.summary: The one-based index of an overlay image within the image list. If this member is set to I_IMAGECALLBACK, the control will request the information by using CBEN_GETDISPINFO notification codes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.iIndent
member.summary: The number of indent spaces to display for the item. Each indentation equals 10 pixels. If this member is set to I_INDENTCALLBACK, the control will request the information by using CBEN_GETDISPINFO notification codes.

param.para: Additional message information. The contents of this parameter depend on the value of uMsg.

param.para: The reference data provided to the SetWindowSubclass function. This can be used to associate the subclass instance with a "this" pointer.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification
member.summary: Notification codes for CommCtrl.h

summary.para: Notifies a control's parent window that the control could not complete an operation because there was not enough memory available. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
The return value is ignored by the control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_CLICK

summary.para: Sent by a list-view control when the user clicks an item with the left mouse button. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

Version 4.71. Pointer to an NMITEMACTIVATE structure that contains additional information about this notification. The iItem, iSubItem, and ptAction members of this structure contain information about the item.
The return value for this notification is not used.

member.remarks: The iItem member of lParam is only valid if the icon or first-column label has been clicked. To determine which item is selected when a click takes place elsewhere in a row, send an LVM_SUBITEMHITTEST message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_DBLCLK

summary.para: Sent by a list-view control when the user double-clicks an item with the left mouse button. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

Version 4.71. Pointer to an NMITEMACTIVATE structure that contains additional information about this notification. The iItem, iSubItem, and ptAction members of this structure contain information about the item.
The return value for this notification is not used.

member.remarks: The iItem member of lParam is only valid if the icon or first-column label has been clicked. To determine which item is selected when a click takes place elsewhere in a row, send an LVM_SUBITEMHITTEST message.

summary.para: Notifies a control's parent window that the control has the input focus and that the user has pressed the ENTER key. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
The return value is ignored by the control.
Notifies the parent window of a tree-view control that the user has clicked the right mouse button within the control. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
Pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
Return nonzero to prevent the default processing, or zero to allow the default processing.
Notifies the parent of a tree-view control that the user has double-clicked the right mouse button within the control. This notification is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
Pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
Return nonzero to prevent the default processing, or zero to allow the default processing.
Notifies a control's parent window that the control has received the input focus. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
The return value is ignored by the control.
Notifies a control's parent window that the control has lost the input focus. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
The return value is ignored by the control.
Notifies a control's parent window about custom drawing operations. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

para.code: NM_CUSTOMDRAW #ifdef LIST_VIEW_CUSTOM_DRAW lpNMCustomDraw = (LPNMLVCUSTOMDRAW) lParam; #elif TOOL_TIPS_CUSTOM_DRAW lpNMCustomDraw = (LPNMTTCUSTOMDRAW) lParam; #elif TREE_VIEW_CUSTOM_DRAW lpNMCustomDraw = (LPNMTVCUSTOMDRAW) lParam; #elif TOOL_BAR_CUSTOM_DRAW lpNMCustomDraw = (LPNMTBCUSTOMDRAW) lParam; #else lpNMCustomDraw = (LPNMCUSTOMDRAW) lParam; #endif

summary.para: A pointer to a custom draw-related structure that contains information about the drawing operation. The following list specifies the controls and their associated structures.

The value your application can return depends on the current drawing stage. The dwDrawStage member of the associated NMCUSTOMDRAW structure holds a value that specifies the drawing stage. You must return one of the following values.

item.term: The control will draw itself. It will not send additional NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification codes for this paint cycle. This flag cannot be used with any other flag.
The control will only draw the background.

Your application specified a new font for the item; the control will use the new font. For more information on changing fonts, see Changing fonts and colors. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

The control will notify the parent of any item-related drawing operations. It will send NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification codes before and after drawing items. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_PREPAINT.
The control will notify the parent after erasing an item. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_PREPAINT.
The control will send an NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification code when the painting cycle for the entire control is complete. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

Your application will receive an NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification code with dwDrawStage set to CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT | CDDS_SUBITEM before each list-view subitem is drawn. You can then specify font and color for each subitem separately or return CDRF_DODEFAULT for default processing. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.
Your application drew the item manually. The control will not draw the item. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.
The control will not draw the focus rectangle around an item.

remarks.para: Currently, the following controls support custom draw functionality: header, list view, rebar, toolbar, tooltip, trackbar, and tree view. Custom draw is also supported for button controls if you have an application manifest to ensure that Comctl32.dll version 6 is available.
If this message is handled in a dialog procedure, you must set the return value as part of the window data before returning TRUE. For more information, see DialogProc.

summary.para: Sent by a control when the mouse hovers over an item. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
Unless otherwise specified, return zero to allow the control to process the hover normally, or nonzero to prevent the hover from being processed.
Sent by a rebar control when the control receives a WM_NCHITTEST message. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to a NMMOUSE structure that contains information about the notification code. The pt member contains the mouse coordinates of the hit test message.

Unless otherwise specified, return zero to allow the control to perform default processing of the hit test message, or return one of the HT* values documented under WM_NCHITTEST to override the default hit test processing.
Sent by a control when the control has the keyboard focus and the user presses a key. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMKEY structure that contains additional information about the key that caused the notification code.
Return nonzero to prevent the control from processing the key, or zero otherwise.
Notifies a control's parent window that the control is releasing mouse capture. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
Unless otherwise specified, the control ignores the return value from this notification code.
Notifies a control's parent window that the control is setting the cursor in response to a WM_SETCURSOR message. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMMOUSE structure that contains additional information about this notification.
Return zero to enable the control to set the cursor or nonzero to prevent the control from setting the cursor.
The NM_CHAR notification code is sent by a control when a character key is processed. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMCHAR structure that contains additional information about the character that caused the notification code.
The return value is ignored by most controls. For more information, see the documentation for the individual controls.
Notifies a control's parent window that the control has created a tooltip control. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMTOOLTIPSCREATED structure that contains additional information about this notification.
Unless otherwise specified, the control ignores the return value from this notification code.
Notifies a control's parent window that the left mouse button has been pressed. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
The return value is ignored by the control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_RDOWN
member.summary: This notification code is not supported.

summary.para: Notifies a control's parent window that the theme has changed. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
The return value is ignored by the control.
Sent by a list-view control when the control has changed a font. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
The return value is ignored by the control.
Notifies a control's parent window about custom text operations. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMCUSTOMTEXT structure that contains additional information about this notification.
The return value is ignored by the control.
Sent by a tree-view control to its parent window that the state image is changing. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMTVSTATEIMAGECHANGING structure that contains additional information about this notification.
The return value is ignored by the control.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState
member.summary: The current item state.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_SELECTED
member.summary: The item is selected.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_GRAYED
member.summary: The item is grayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_DISABLED
member.summary: The item is disabled.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_CHECKED
member.summary: The item is in focus.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_FOCUS
member.summary: The item is in focus.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_DEFAULT
member.summary: The item is in its default state.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_HOT
member.summary: The item is currently under the pointer ("hot").

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_MARKED
member.summary: The item is marked. The meaning of this is determined by the implementation. This flag does not work correctly for owner-drawn list-view controls that have the LVS_SHOWSELALWAYS style. For these controls, you can determine whether an item is selected by using LVM_GETITEMSTATE (or ListView_GetItemState) and checking for the LVIS_SELECTED flag.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_INDETERMINATE
member.summary: The item is in an indeterminate state.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_SHOWKEYBOARDCUES
member.summary: Version 6.0.The item is showing its keyboard cues. Comctl32 version 6 is not redistributable. operating systems. To use Comctl32.dll version 6, specify it in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_NEARHOT
member.summary: The item is part of a control that is currently under the mouse pointer ("hot"), but the item is not "hot" itself. The meaning of this is determined by the implementation.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_OTHERSIDEHOT
member.summary: The item is part of a splitbutton that is currently under the mouse pointer ("hot"), but the item is not "hot" itself. The meaning of this is determined by the implementation.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_DROPHILITED
member.summary: The item is currently the drop target of a drag-and-drop operation.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse
member.summary: These constants are used as return values by a control in response to an NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification code.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_DODEFAULT
member.summary: The control will draw itself. It will not send any additional NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification codes for this paint cycle. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_NEWFONT
member.summary: The application specified a new font for the item; the control will use the new font. For more information about changing fonts, see Changing fonts and colors. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_SKIPDEFAULT
member.summary: The application drew the item manually. The control will not draw the item. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_DOERASE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The control will draw the background.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_NOTIFYPOSTPAINT
member.summary: The control will notify the parent after painting an item. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_NOTIFYITEMDRAW
member.summary: The control will notify the parent of any item-related drawing operations. It will send NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification codes before and after drawing items. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_NOTIFYSUBITEMDRAW
member.summary: Internet Explorer 4.0 and later. The control will notify the parent of any item-related drawing operations. It will send NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification codes before and after drawing items. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_PREPAINT. This flag is identical to CDRF_NOTIFYITEMDRAW and its use is context-dependent.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_NOTIFYPOSTERASE
member.summary: The control will notify the parent after erasing an item. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_SKIPPOSTPAINT
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The control will not draw the focus rectangle.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage
member.summary: The current drawing stage.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_POSTPAINT

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_PREERASE

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_POSTERASE

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_ITEM

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_ITEMPOSTPAINT

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_ITEMPOSTERASE

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HotItemChangeFlags

member.summary: The change in the hot item resulted from an event that could not be determined. This will most often be due to a change in focus or the TB_SETHOTITEM message.

member.summary: The change in the hot item resulted from a mouse event.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HotItemChangeFlags.HICF_LEAVING

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HotItemChangeFlags.HICF_LMOUSE

member.summary: Calculates the dimensions of a rectangle in the client area that contains all the specified controls.

param.para: A handle to the window that has the client area to check.

param.name: lprc
param.para: A pointer to a RECT structure that receives the dimensions of the rectangle.

param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated array of integers that identify controls in the client area. Each control requires a pair of consecutive elements. The first element of the pair must be nonzero and the second element of the pair must be the control identifier. The first pair represents the menu and is ignored. The last element must be zero to identify the end of the array.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.GetMUILanguage
member.summary: Gets the language currently in use by the common controls for a particular process.

returns.para: Type: LANGID

Returns the language identifier of the language an application has specified for the common controls by calling InitMUILanguage. GetMUILanguage returns the value for the process from which it is called. If InitMUILanguage has not been called or was not called from the same process, GetMUILanguage returns the language-neutral LANGID, MAKELANGID(LANG_NEUTRAL, SUBLANG_NEUTRAL).

param.name: pdwRefData
param.para: A pointer to a DWORD which will return the reference data. Note: On 64-bit versions of Windows, pointers are 64-bit values.

returns.para: Type: BOOL

item.term: The subclass callback was successfully installed.
The subclass callback was not installed.

param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated, Unicode buffer that contains location information about the icon to load. It is interpreted as follows:
If hinst is NULL, pszName can specify one of two things.
If hinst is non-null, pszName can specify one of two things.

param.name: lims

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.LoadIconWithScaleDown(Vanara.PInvoke.HINSTANCE,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Loads an icon. If the icon is not a standard size, this function scales down a larger image instead of scaling up a smaller image.

param.name: hinst
param.para: A handle to the module of either a DLL or executable (.exe) file that contains the icon to be loaded. For more information, see GetModuleHandle.
To load a predefined icon or a standalone icon file, set this parameter to NULL.

param.name: pszName
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated, Unicode buffer that contains location information about the icon to load.
If hinst is non- NULL, pszName specifies the icon resource either by name or ordinal. This ordinal must be packaged by using the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro.

If hinst is NULL, pszName specifies either the name of a standalone icon (.ico) file or the identifier of a predefined icon to load. The following identifiers are recognized. To pass these constants to the LoadIconWithScaleDown function, use the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro. For example, to load the IDI_ERROR icon, pass as the pszName parameter and NULL as the hinst parameter.

param.name: cx
param.para: The desired width, in pixels, of the icon.

param.name: cy
param.para: The desired height, in pixels, of the icon.

param.name: phico
param.para: When this function returns, contains a pointer to the handle of the loaded icon.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise, including the following:

item.term: The contents of the buffer pointed to by pszName do not fit any of the expected interpretations.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.RemoveWindowSubclass(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.SUBCLASSPROC,System.UIntPtr)
member.summary: Removes a subclass callback from a window.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: The handle of the window being subclassed.

param.name: pfnSubclass
param.para: A pointer to a window procedure. This pointer and the subclass ID uniquely identify this subclass callback. For the callback function prototype, see SUBCLASSPROC.

param.name: uIdSubclass
param.para: The UINT_PTR subclass ID. This ID and the callback pointer uniquely identify this subclass callback. Note: On 64-bit versions of Windows this is a 64-bit value.

returns.para: Type: BOOL

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.SetWindowSubclass(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.SUBCLASSPROC,System.UIntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Installs or updates a window subclass callback.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: The handle of the window being subclassed.

param.name: pfnSubclass
param.para: A pointer to a window procedure. This pointer and the subclass ID uniquely identify this subclass callback. For the callback function prototype, see SUBCLASSPROC.

param.name: uIdSubclass
param.para: The subclass ID. This ID together with the subclass procedure uniquely identify a subclass. To remove a subclass, pass the subclass procedure and this value to the RemoveWindowSubclass function. This value is passed to the subclass procedure in the uIdSubclass parameter.

param.name: dwRefData
param.para: DWORD_PTR to reference data. The meaning of this value is determined by the calling application. This value is passed to the subclass procedure in the dwRefData parameter. A different dwRefData is associated with each combination of window handle, subclass procedure and uIdSubclass.

returns.para: Type: BOOL
TRUE if the subclass callback was successfully installed; otherwise, FALSE.

summary.para: [ ShowHideMenuCtl is available for use in the operating systems specified in the Requirements section. It may be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions.]

Sets or removes the specified menu item's check mark attribute and shows or hides the corresponding control. The function adds a check mark to the specified menu item if it does not have one and then displays the corresponding control. If the menu item already has a check mark, the function removes the check mark and hides the corresponding control.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: A handle to the window that contains the menu and controls.

param.name: uFlags
param.para: The identifier of the menu item to receive or lose a check mark.

param.name: lpInfo
param.para: A pointer to an array that contains pairs of values. The second value in the first pair must be the handle to the application's main menu. Each subsequent pair consists of a menu item identifier and a control window identifier. The function searches the array for a value that matches uFlags and, if the value is found, checks or unchecks the menu item and shows or hides the corresponding control.

returns.para: Type: BOOL
Returns nonzero if successful, or zero otherwise.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMCUSTOMTEXT
member.summary: Contains information used with custom text notification.

summary.para: Type: NMHDR
An NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
Type: HDC
The device context to draw to.
Type: LPCWSTR
The string to draw.
Type: int
Length of lpString.
Type: LPRECT
The rect to draw in.
Type: UINT
One or more of the DT_* flags. For more information, see the description of the uFormat parameter of the DrawText function. This may be NULL.
Type: BOOL
Whether the text is a link.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMKEY
member.summary: Contains information used with key notification messages.

summary.para: Type: NMHDR
An NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
Type: UINT
A virtual key code of the key that caused the event.
Type: UINT
Flags associated with the key. These are the same flags that are passed in the high word of the lParam parameter of the WM_KEYDOWN message.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMMOUSE

An NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
Type: DWORD_PTR
A control-specific item identifier.
Type: DWORD_PTR
A control-specific item data.
Type: POINT
A POINT structure that contains the client coordinates of the mouse when the click occurred.
Type: LPARAM
Carries information about where on the item or control the cursor is pointing.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMOBJECTNOTIFY
member.summary: Contains information used with the TBN_GETOBJECT, TCN_GETOBJECT, and PSN_GETOBJECT notification codes.

summary.para: Type: NMHDR
An NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
Type: int

A control-specific item identifier. This value will comply to item identification standards for the control sending the notification. However, this member is not used with the PSN_GETOBJECT notification code.
Type: IID*
A pointer to an interface identifier of the requested object.
Type: IUnknown*
A pointer to an object provided by the window processing the notification code. The application processing the notification code sets this member.
Type: HRESULT
COM success or failure flags. The application processing the notification code sets this member.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag
member.summary: The variable that receives information about the results of a hit test.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ABOVE
member.summary: The point is above the header control's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_BELOW
member.summary: The point is below the header control's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_NOWHERE
member.summary: The point is inside the header control's bounding rectangle but is not over a header item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONDIVIDER
member.summary: The point is on the divider between two header items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONDIVOPEN
member.summary: The point is on the divider of an item that has a width of zero. Dragging the divider reveals the item instead of resizing the item to the left of the divider.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONDROPDOWN
member.summary: The point is within the split button of the item. The style HDF_SPLITBUTTON must be set on the item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONFILTER
member.summary: The point is over the filter area.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONFILTERBUTTON
member.summary: The point is on the filter button.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONHEADER
member.summary: The point is to the left of the header control's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONITEMSTATEICON
member.summary: The point is within the state icon of the item. If style HDS_CHECKBOXES is specified, the point is within the checkbox of the item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONOVERFLOW
member.summary: The point is within the overflow button of the header control. The style HDS_OVERFLOW must be set on the header control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_TOLEFT
member.summary: The point is to the left of the header control's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_TORIGHT
member.summary: The point is to the right of the header control's bounding rectangle.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat
member.summary: Flags that specify an format.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_LEFT
member.summary: The item's contents are left-aligned.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_RIGHT
member.summary: The item's contents are right-aligned.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_CENTER
member.summary: The item's contents are centered.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_JUSTIFYMASK
member.summary: Isolate the bits corresponding to the three justification flags listed in the preceding table.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_RTLREADING
member.summary: Typically, windows displays text left-to-right (LTR). Windows can be mirrored to display languages such as Hebrew or Arabic that read right-to-left (RTL). Usually, header text is read in the same direction as the text in its parent window. If HDF_RTLREADING is set, header text will read in the opposite direction from the text in the parent window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_CHECKBOX
member.summary: The item displays a checkbox. The flag is only valid when the HDS_CHECKBOXES style is first set on the header control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_CHECKED
member.summary: The item displays a checked checkbox. The flag is only valid when HDF_CHECKBOX is also set.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_FIXEDWIDTH
member.summary: The width of the item cannot be modified by a user action to resize it.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_OWNERDRAW
member.summary: The header control's owner draws the item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_STRING
member.summary: The item displays a string.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_BITMAP
member.summary: The item displays a bitmap.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_BITMAP_ON_RIGHT
member.summary: The bitmap appears to the right of text.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_IMAGE
member.summary: Display an image from an image list. Specify the image list by sending an HDM_SETIMAGELIST message. Specify the index of the image in the iImage member of this structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_SORTUP
member.summary: Draws an up-arrow on this item. This is typically used to indicate that information in the current window is sorted on this column in ascending order. This flag cannot be combined with HDF_IMAGE or HDF_BITMAP.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_SORTDOWN
member.summary: Draws a down-arrow on this item. This is typically used to indicate that information in the current window is sorted on this column in descending order. This flag cannot be combined with HDF_IMAGE or HDF_BITMAP.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_SPLITBUTTON
member.summary: The item displays a split button. The HDN_DROPDOWN notification is sent when the split button is clicked.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemImageDisplay
member.summary: Determines which type of bitmap is displayed on a header column.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemImageDisplay.None
member.summary: All flags related to image display are cleared.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemImageDisplay.Bitmap
member.summary: Display a supplied bitmap image. Correlates to HDF_BITMAP.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemImageDisplay.ImageListItem
member.summary: Display a supplied image-list item. Correlates to HDF_IMAGE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemImageDisplay.DownArrow
member.summary: Display a system defined down arrow. Correlates to HDF_SORTDOWN.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemImageDisplay.UpArrow
member.summary: Display a system defined up arrow. Correlates to HDF_SORTUP.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemMask
member.summary: Flags indicating which structure members contain valid data or must be filled in.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemMask.HDI_BITMAP

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemMask.HDI_DI_SETITEM
member.summary: While handling the message HDM_GETITEM, the header control may not have all the values needed to complete the request. In this case, the control must call the application back for the values via the HDN_GETDISPINFO notification. If HDI_DI_SETITEM has been passed in the HDM_GETITEM message, the control will cache any values returned from HDN_GETDISPINFO (otherwise the values remain unset.)

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemMask.HDI_FILTER
member.summary: The and members are valid. This is used to filter out the values specified in the type member.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemMask.HDI_FORMAT
member.summary: The member is valid.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemMask.HDI_LPARAM
member.summary: The member is valid.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage
member.summary: Header Control Messages

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_CLEARFILTER
member.summary:
Clears the filter for a given header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_ClearFilter macro.
Parameters
wParam
A column value indicating which filter to clear.
lParam
Must be zero.
Returns
Returns an integer. The LRESULT is cast to an integer that indicates TRUE(1) or FALSE(0).
member.remarks: If the column value is specified as -1, all the filters are cleared, and the HDN_FILTERCHANGE notification is sent only once.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_CREATEDRAGIMAGE
member.summary:
Creates a semi-transparent version of an item's image for use as a dragging image. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_CreateDragImage macro.
Parameters
wParam
The zero-based index of the item within the header control. The image assigned to this item is the basis for the transparent image.
lParam
Must be zero.
Returns
Returns a handle to an image list that contains the new image as its only element.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_DELETEITEM
member.summary:
Deletes an item from a header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_DeleteItem macro.
Parameters
wParam
An index of the item to delete.
lParam
Must be zero.
Returns
Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_EDITFILTER
member.summary:
Moves the input focus to the edit box when a filter button has the focus.
Parameters
wParam
A value specifying the column to edit.
lParam
A flag that specifies how to handle the user's editing changes. Use this flag to specify what to do if the user is in the process of editing the filter when the message is sent.
Value Meaning
TRUE Discard the changes made by the user.
FALSE Accept the changes made by the user.
Returns
Returns an integer. The LRESULT is cast to an integer that indicates TRUE(1) or FALSE(0).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_GETBITMAPMARGIN
member.summary:
Gets the width of the bitmap margin for a header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_GetBitmapMargin macro.
Parameters
wParam
Must be zero.
lParam
Must be zero.
Returns
Returns the width of the bitmap margin in pixels. If the bitmap margin was not previously specified, the default value of 3* GetSystemMetrics (SM_CXEDGE) is returned.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_GETFOCUSEDITEM
member.summary:
Gets the item in a header control that has the focus. Send this message explicitly or by using the Header_GetFocusedItem macro.
Parameters
wParam
Not used. Must be zero.
lParam
Not used. Must be zero.
Returns
Returns the index of the item in focus.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_GETIMAGELIST
member.summary:
Gets the handle to the image list that has been set for an existing header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_GetImageList or Header_GetStateImageList macro.
Parameters
*wParam*
One of the following values:
Value Meaning
HDSIL_NORMAL Indicates that this is a normal image list.
HDSIL_STATE Indicates that this is a state image list.
lParam
Must be zero.
Returns
Returns a handle to the image list set for the header control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_GETITEM
member.summary:
Gets information about an item in a header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_GetItem macro.
Parameters
wParam
The index of the item for which information is to be retrieved.
lParam
A pointer to an HDITEM structure. When the message is sent, the mask member indicates the type of information being requested. When the message returns, the other members receive the requested information. If the mask member specifies zero, the message returns TRUE but copies no information to the structure.
Returns
Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.
member.remarks: If the HDI_TEXT flag is set in the mask member of the HDITEM structure, the control may change the pszText member of the structure to point to the new text instead of filling the buffer with the requested text. Applications should not assume that the text will always be placed in the requested buffer.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_GETITEMCOUNT
member.summary:
Gets a count of the items in a header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_GetItemCount macro.
Parameters
wParam
Must be zero.
lParam
Must be zero.
Returns
Returns the number of items if successful, or -1 otherwise.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_GETITEMDROPDOWNRECT
member.summary:
Gets the bounding rectangle of the split button for a header item with style HDF_SPLITBUTTON. Send this message explicitly or by using the Header_GetItemDropDownRect macro.
Parameters
wParam
The zero-based index of the header control item for which to retrieve the bounding rectangle.
lParam
A pointer to a RECT structure that receives the bounding rectangle information. The message sender is responsible for allocating this structure. The coordinates returned in the RECT structure are expressed relative to the header control parent.
Returns
Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.
member.remarks: The header item must have style HDF_SPLITBUTTON.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_GETITEMRECT
member.summary:
Gets the bounding rectangle for a given item in a header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_GetItemRect macro.
Parameters
wParam
The zero-based index of the header control item for which to retrieve the bounding rectangle.
lParam
A pointer to a RECT structure that receives the bounding rectangle information. The message sender is responsible for allocating this structure. The coordinates returned in the RECT structure are expressed relative to the header control parent.
Returns
Returns nonzero if successful, or zero otherwise.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_GETORDERARRAY
member.summary:
Gets the current left-to-right order of items in a header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_GetOrderArray macro.
Parameters
wParam
The number of integer elements that lParam can hold. This value must be equal to the number of items in the control (see HDM_GETITEMCOUNT).
lParam
A pointer to an array of integers that receive the index values for items in the header.
Returns
Returns nonzero if successful, and the buffer at lParam receives the item number for each item in the header control in the order in which they appear from left to right. Otherwise, the message returns zero.

remarks.para: The number of elements in lParam is specified in wParam and must be equal to the number of items in the control. For example, the following code fragment will reserve enough memory to hold the index values.

para.code: int iItems, *lpiArray; // Get memory for buffer. (iItems = SendMessage(hwndHD, HDM_GETITEMCOUNT, 0,0))!=-1) if(!(lpiArray = calloc(iItems,sizeof(int)))) MessageBox(hwnd, "Out of memory.","Error", MB_OK);

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_GETOVERFLOWRECT
member.summary:
Gets the bounding rectangle of the overflow button when the HDS_OVERFLOW style is set on the header control and the overflow button is visible. Send this message explicitly or by using the Header_GetOverflowRect macro.
Parameters
wParam
Not used. Must be zero.
lParam
A pointer to a RECT structure to receive the bounding rectangle information. The message sender is responsible for allocating this structure. The coordinates returned in the RECT structure are expressed as screen coordinates.
Returns
Returns TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: The header control must have style HDF_SPLITBUTTON.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_GETUNICODEFORMAT
member.summary:
Gets the Unicode character format flag for the control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_GetUnicodeFormat macro.
Parameters
wParam
Must be zero.
lParam
Must be zero.
Returns
Returns the Unicode format flag for the control. If this value is nonzero, the control is using Unicode characters. If this value is zero, the control is using ANSI characters.
member.remarks: See the remarks for CCM_GETUNICODEFORMAT for a discussion of this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_HITTEST
member.summary:
Tests a point to determine which header item, if any, is at the specified point.
Parameters
wParam
Must be zero.
lParam
A pointer to an HDHITTESTINFO structure that contains the position to test and receives information about the results of the test.
Returns
Returns the index of the item at the specified position, if any, or 1 otherwise.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_INSERTITEM
member.summary:
Inserts a new item into a header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_InsertItem macro.
Parameters
wParam
The index of the item after which the new item is to be inserted. The new item is inserted at the end of the header control if wParam is greater than or equal to the number of items in the control. If wParam is zero, the new item is inserted at the beginning of the header control.
lParam
A pointer to an HDITEM structure that contains information about the new item.
Returns
Returns the index of the new item if successful, or -1 otherwise.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_LAYOUT
member.summary:
Retrieves information used to set the size and position of the header control within the target rectangle of the parent window. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_Layout macro.
Parameters
wParam
Must be zero.
lParam
A pointer to an HDLAYOUT structure. The prc member specifies the coordinates of a rectangle, and the pwpos member receives the size and position for the header control within the rectangle.
Returns
Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

remarks.para: The pwpos member of the lParam structure receives size and position values appropriate for positioning the control along the top of the specified rectangle. The height value is the sum of the heights of the control's horizontal borders and the average height of characters in the font currently selected into the control's device context.

To use HDM_LAYOUT to set the initial size and position of a header control, set the initial visibility state of the control so that it is hidden. After sending HDM_LAYOUT to retrieve the size and position values, use the SetWindowPos function to set the new size, position, and visibility state.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_ORDERTOINDEX
member.summary:
Retrieves an index value for an item based on its order in the header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_OrderToIndex macro.
Parameters
wParam
The order in which the item appears within the header control, from left to right. For example, the index value of the item in the far left column would be 0. The value for the next item to the right would be 1, and so on.
lParam
Must be zero.
Returns
Returns INT that indicates the item index. If wParam is invalid (negative or too large), the return equals wParam.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_SETBITMAPMARGIN
member.summary:
Sets the width of the margin, specified in pixels, of a bitmap in an existing header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_SetBitmapMargin macro.
Parameters
wParam
The width, specified in pixels, of the margin that surrounds a bitmap within an existing header control.
lParam
Must be zero.
Returns
Returns the width of the bitmap margin, in pixels. If the bitmap margin was not previously specified, the default value of 3* GetSystemMetrics (SM_CXEDGE) is returned.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_SETFILTERCHANGETIMEOUT
member.summary:
Sets the timeout interval between the time a change takes place in the filter attributes and the posting of an HDN_FILTERCHANGE notification. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_SetFilterChangeTimeout macro.
Parameters
wParam
Must be zero.
lParam
The timeout value, in milliseconds.
Returns
Returns the index of the filter control being modified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_SETFOCUSEDITEM
member.summary:
Sets the focus to a specified item in a header control. Send this message explicitly or by using the Header_SetFocusedItem macro.
Parameters
wParam
Not used. Must be zero.
lParam
The index of item.
Returns
Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_SETHOTDIVIDER
member.summary:
Changes the color of a divider between header items to indicate the destination of an external drag-and-drop operation. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_SetHotDivider macro.
Parameters
wParam
The type of value represented by lParam. This value can be one of the following:
Value Meaning
TRUE Indicates that lParam holds the client coordinates of the pointer.
FALSE Indicates that lParam holds a divider index value.
lParam
A value held in lParam is interpreted depending on the value of wParam.
If wParam is TRUE, lParam represents the x- and y-coordinates of the pointer. The x-coordinate is in the low word, and the y-coordinate is in the high word. When the header control receives the message, it highlights the appropriate divider based on the lParam coordinates.
If wParam is FALSE, lParam represents the integer index of the divider to be highlighted.
Returns
Returns a value equal to the index of the divider that the control highlighted.
member.remarks: This message creates an effect that a header control automatically produces when it has the HDS_DRAGDROP style. The HDM_SETHOTDIVIDER message is intended to be used when the owner of the control handles drag-and-drop operations manually.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_SETIMAGELIST
member.summary:
Assigns an image list to an existing header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_SetImageList or Header_SetStateImageList macro.
Parameters
*wParam*
One of the following values:
Value Meaning
HDSIL_NORMAL Indicates that this is a normal image list.
HDSIL_STATE Indicates that this is a state image list.
lParam
A handle to an image list.
Returns
Returns the handle to the image list previously associated with the control. Returns NULL upon failure or if no image list was set previously.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_SETITEM
member.summary:
Sets the attributes of the specified item in a header control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_SetItem macro.
Parameters
wParam
The current index of the item whose attributes are to be changed.
lParam
A pointer to an HDITEM structure that contains item information. When this message is sent, the mask member of the structure must be set to indicate which attributes are being set.
Returns
Returns nonzero upon success, or zero otherwise.
member.remarks: The HDITEM structure that supports this message supports item order and image list information. By using these members, you can control the order in which items are displayed and specify images to appear with items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_SETORDERARRAY
member.summary:
Sets the left-to-right order of header items. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_SetOrderArray macro.
Parameters
wParam
The size of the buffer at lParam, in elements. This value must equal the value returned by HDM_GETITEMCOUNT.
lParam
A pointer to an array that specifies the order in which items should be displayed, from left to right. For example, if the contents of the array are {2,0,1}, the control displays item 2, item 0, and item 1, from left to right.
Returns
Returns nonzero if successful, or zero otherwise.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderMessage.HDM_SETUNICODEFORMAT
member.summary:
Sets the UNICODE character format flag for the control. This message allows you to change the character set used by the control at run time rather than having to re-create the control. You can send this message explicitly or use the Header_SetUnicodeFormat macro.
Parameters
wParam
The character set that is used by the control. If this value is nonzero, the control will use Unicode characters. If this value is zero, the control will use ANSI characters.
lParam
Must be zero.
Returns
Returns the previous Unicode format flag for the control.
member.remarks: See the remarks for CCM_SETUNICODEFORMAT for a discussion of this message.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification
member.summary: Header control notifications

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_BEGINDRAG

summary.para: Sent by a header control when a drag operation has begun on one of its items. This notification code is sent only by header controls that are set to the HDS_DRAGDROP style. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure containing information about the header item that is being dragged.
To allow the header control to automatically manage drag-and-drop operations, return FALSE. If the owner of the control is manually performing drag-and-drop reordering, return TRUE.

member.remarks: A header control defaults to automatically managing drag-and-drop reordering. Returning TRUE to indicate external (manual) drag-and-drop management allows the owner of the control to provide custom services as part of the drag-and-drop process.

summary.para: Notifies a header control's parent window that a filter edit has begun. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains additional information about the filter that is being edited.
No return value.

Notifies a header control's parent window that the user has begun dragging a divider in the control (that is, the user has pressed the left mouse button while the mouse cursor is on a divider in the header control). This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control and the item whose divider is to be dragged.
Returns FALSE to allow tracking of the divider, or TRUE to prevent tracking.
Notifies a header control's parent window that the user double-clicked the divider area of the control. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control and the item whose divider was double-clicked.
No return value.
Sent by a header control to its parent when the drop-down arrow on the header control is clicked. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information on the header control.
No return value.

remarks.para: The example in the Syntax section shows how the notification receiver casts LPARAM to retrieve the NMHEADER structure. WPARAM contains the ID of the control that sends this message.
This message is sent only if style HDF_SPLITBUTTON is set on the header item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_ENDDRAG

summary.para: Sent by a header control when a drag operation has ended on one of its items. This notification code is sent as a WM_NOTIFY message. Only header controls that are set to the HDS_DRAGDROP style send this notification code.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure containing information about the header item that was being dragged.
To allow the control to automatically place and reorder the item, return FALSE. To prevent the item from being placed, return TRUE.

member.remarks: If the owner is performing external (manual) drag-and-drop management, it must return FALSE. The owner then must reorder header items manually by sending HDM_SETITEM or HDM_SETORDERARRAY.

summary.para: Notifies a header control's parent window that a filter edit has ended. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains additional information about the filter that is being edited.
No return value.
Notifies a header control's parent window that the user has finished dragging a divider. This notification code sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control and the item whose divider was dragged.
No return value.
Notifies the header control's parent window when the filter button is clicked or in response to an HDM_SETITEM message. This notification code sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHDFILTERBTNCLICK structure that contains information about the header control and the header filter button.

If you return TRUE, an HDN_FILTERCHANGE notification code will be sent to the header control's parent window. This notification code gives the parent window an opportunity to synchronize its user interface elements. Return FALSE if you do not want the notification sent.
Notifies the header control's parent window that the attributes of a header control filter are being changed or edited. This notification code sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control and the header item, including the attributes that are about to change.
No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_GETDISPINFO

summary.para: Sent to the owner of a header control when the control needs information about a callback header item. This notification code is sent as a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHDDISPINFO structure. On input, the fields of the structure specify what information is required and the item of interest.
Returns an LRESULT.

member.remarks: Fill the appropriate members of the structure to return the requested information to the header control. If your message handler sets the mask member of the NMHDDISPINFO structure to HDI_DI_SETITEM, the header control stores the information and will not request it again.

summary.para: Notifies a header control's parent window that the attributes of a header item have changed. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control, including the attributes that have changed.
No return value.
Notifies a header control's parent window that the attributes of a header item are about to change. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control and the header item, including the attributes that are about to change.
Returns FALSE to allow the changes, or TRUE to prevent them.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_ITEMCLICK

summary.para: Notifies a header control's parent window that the user clicked the control. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that identifies the header control and specifies the index of the header item that was clicked and the mouse button used to click the item. The pItem member is set to NULL.
No return value.

member.remarks: A header control sends this notification code after the user releases the left mouse button.

summary.para: Notifies a header control's parent window that the user double-clicked the control. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message. Only header controls that are set to the HDS_BUTTONS style send this notification code.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about this notification code.
No return value.
Notifies a header control's parent window that a key has been pressed with an item selected. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains additional information about the key that is being pressed.
No return value.
Notifies a header control's parent window that the user clicked an item's state icon. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains additional information about the state icon that was clicked on.
No return value.
Sent by a header control to its parent when the header's overflow button is clicked. This notification code is sent in the form of an WM_NOTIFY message.

A pointer to a NMHEADER structure that describes the notification code. The calling process is responsible for allocating this structure, including the contained NMHDR structure. Set the members of the NMHDR structure, including the code member that must be set to HDN_OVERFLOWCLICK.
Set the iItem member of the NMHEADER structure to the index of the first header item that is not visible and thus should be displayed on an overflow.
No return value.

remarks.para: The notification receiver casts LPARAM to retrieve the NMHEADER structure. WPARAM contains the ID of the control that sends the notification.
This message is sent only when style HDS_OVERFLOW is set on the header control.

summary.para: Notifies a header control's parent window that the user is dragging a divider in the header control. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control and the item whose divider is being dragged.
Returns FALSE to continue tracking the divider, or TRUE to end tracking.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle
member.summary: Header controls have a number of styles, described in this section, that determine the control's appearance and behavior. You set the initial styles when you create the header control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_BUTTONS
member.summary: Each item in the control looks and behaves like a push button. This style is useful if an application carries out a task when the user clicks an item in the header control. For example, an application could sort information in the columns differently depending on which item the user clicks.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_DRAGDROP
member.summary: Allows drag-and-drop reordering of header items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_FILTERBAR
member.summary: Include a filter bar as part of the standard header control. This bar allows users to conveniently apply a filter to the display. Calls to HDM_LAYOUT will yield a new size for the control and cause the list view to update.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_FLAT
member.summary: Version 6.0 and later. Causes the header control to be drawn flat when the operating system is running in classic mode. Comctl32.dll version 6 is not redistributable but it is included in Windows. To use Comctl32.dll version 6, specify it in a manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_FULLDRAG
member.summary: Causes the header control to display column contents even while the user resizes a column.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_HIDDEN
member.summary: Indicates a header control that is intended to be hidden. This style does not hide the control. Instead, when you send the HDM_LAYOUT message to a header control with the HDS_HIDDEN style, the control returns zero in the cy member of the WINDOWPOS structure. You would then hide the control by setting its height to zero. This can be useful when you want to use the control as an information container instead of a visual control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_HORZ
member.summary: Creates a header control with a horizontal orientation.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_HOTTRACK
member.summary: Enables hot tracking.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_CHECKBOXES
member.summary: Version 6.00 and later. Allows the placing of checkboxes on header items. For more information, see the fmt member of HDITEM.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_NOSIZING
member.summary: Version 6.00 and later. The user cannot drag the divider on the header control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_OVERFLOW
member.summary: Version 6.00 and later. A button is displayed when not all items can be displayed within the header control's rectangle. When clicked, this button sends an HDN_OVERFLOWCLICK notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDTEXTFILTER.cchTextMax

member.returns: A that represents this instance.

member.summary: Contains information about a hit test. This structure is used with the HDM_HITTEST message and it supersedes the HD_HITTESTINFO structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDHITTESTINFO.pt
member.summary: A POINT structure that contains the point to be hit test, in client coordinates.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDHITTESTINFO.flags
member.summary: The variable that receives information about the results of a hit test. Two of these values can be combined, such as when the position is above and to the left of the client area.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDHITTESTINFO.iItem
member.summary: If the hit test is successful, contains the index of the item at the hit test point.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM
member.summary: Contains information about an item in a header control. This structure supersedes the HD_ITEM structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.mask
member.summary: Flags indicating which other structure members contain valid data or must be filled in.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.cxy
member.summary: The width or height of the item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.pszText
member.summary: A pointer to an item string. If the text is being retrieved from the control, this member must be initialized to point to a character buffer. If this member is set to LPSTR_TEXTCALLBACK, the control will request text information for this item by sending an HDN_GETDISPINFO notification code. Note that although the header control allows a string of any length to be stored as item text, only the first 260 TCHARs are displayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.hbm
member.summary: A handle to the item bitmap.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.cchTextMax
member.summary: The length of the item string, in TCHARs. If the text is being retrieved from the control, this member must contain the number of TCHARs at the address specified by pszText.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.fmt
member.summary: Flags that specify the item's format.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.lParam
member.summary: Application-defined item data.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.iImage
member.summary: The zero-based index of an image within the image list. The specified image will be displayed in the header item in addition to any image specified in the hbm field. If iImage is set to I_IMAGECALLBACK, the control requests text information for this item by using an HDN_GETDISPINFO notification code. To clear the image, set this value to I_IMAGENONE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.iOrder
member.summary: The order in which the item appears within the header control, from left to right. That is, the value for the far left item is 0. The value for the next item to the right is 1, and so on.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.type
member.summary: The type of filter specified by pvFilter.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.pvFilter
member.summary: The address of an application-defined data item. The data filter type is determined by setting the flag value of the member. Use the HDFT_ISSTRING flag to indicate a string and HDFT_ISNUMBER to indicate an integer. When the HDFT_ISSTRING flag is used pvFilter is a pointer to a HDTEXTFILTER structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.state

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the bitmap is on the right.

Value Meaning
